page.title: 13MAPPERLEY
page.content: {BUILDINGS} The Post Office and general store is useful for things to buy that you would use everyday. It is a small shop with a small post office on the left,a fridge counter straight ahead and a window on the right with a ledge on which are penny sweets. When we went we would not ask many questions because the man there was a friend who was just looking after the shop for the day. It is on a corner of the street at the cross roads so it is easy for all the villagers to reach. The public house in Mapperley is called the Black Horse, the owners have been in the Pub for 18 months. It consists of a tap room, smoke room and a hall with old farm tools and gambling machines. The brewers are Kimberley Ales. There are 2 churches, a Methodist and Church Of England.
